Reviews.Content: Nice hotel good price We have been this hotel 2 years ago .That time did not know about a few things:you have 2 ask nice ,bright room otherwise they give u a ground floor dark one!!!So now I did ask and we got on the 4 floor with nice view.The room nice ,big, clean and the bathroom 2.The breakfast is o.k would be better.For 14 euro ...expensive and the coffee not good but the peach juice was very nice.The staff working well and speak english! Excellent location. In Madrid's downtown.The downside of this hotel is that the streets surrounding with noisy but not 2 much.This hotel close 2 everything.4 days we did not buy any ticket easily can go anywhere.We had a lovely time there.Thank you.
Reviews.Author: SmallWizard

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great value. We had a very nice stay at this hotel (and definitely worth the 60 euros/night I nabbed on venere.com). The rooms were a nice size, well furnished, clean, the bathrooms large and modern and the front desk staff pleasant and helpful. Our rooms were on the first floor and got a bit of street noise. There is a decent, trendy restaurant - El Original - and Starbucks right across the street which was great for morning coffee and in the evening when we wanted to just grab a bite and crash.
Reviews.Author: kris727

Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel Only stayed the one night but booking was really simple on [-]. The hotel is in a great location and even though it was mid August, there was plenty going on in the evening (bars and clubs still open). The rooms and public areas seem recently refurbished and (as in some earlier reviews here) the beds ARE preety hard. My only gripe was that the (free) WiFi had really intermittent service and was really frustrating trying to do emails.Would definitely go back - if only to make sure I'm staggering distance from the bars and clubs. ;-)
Reviews.Author: Sackville

Reviews.Content: Really enjoyable stay. After arriving in Madrid, my first hotel was terrible so I jumped on Priceline UK and found the Hotel Lusso Infantas. It was very reasonable (for Europe) 100 Euros avg per night for three nights. The front desk staff was very kind and efficient. The room was stylish and comfortable, with laminate floors, nice lighting, and flat screen TV. The bathroom was large and modern. A nice box of toiletries was supplied. View was only to an interior courtyard but allowed good light to come in.Very nice experience and great location. Two blocks from the Banco de Espana metro stop and right in Chueca near lots of bars and restaurants. Would definitely stay again.
Reviews.Author: brooklynsd

Reviews.Content: Very Nice - But Doubt I'd Go Back The hotel itself is very nice. It is expensive, but well located, clean, modern and friendly staff. I had however two major problems that would put me off staying here again:1 - The bedroom where we stayed had a wooden floor and it seems they never cleaned under the bed as it had a thick layer of dust.2 - The bed must have come from a second hand shop!! It is the most uncomfortable thing I have ever slept in, worse than anything from my college days. Even a belly full of beer at night didn't help!!! For such an expensive hotel to even be in possession of something so crap beggars belief..Of course I should have complained, but we had an itinerary planned before we even got there that saw us away early in the morning and back late at night so there wouldn't have really been a time to move. In hindsight though.....Anyway, based on the appalling bed, I wouldn't go back. There are any amount of hotels in Madrid so next time I'll try somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: Irish_Traveller085

Reviews.Content: Nice room but expensive Stayed there with 2 young children over Easter. Great location - handy for the Retiro park and the centre of town. Room was large and comfortable. Maybe the UK pound is just weak at the moment but felt the damage in the wallet - 200 euros a night room only. That said, would recommend it to those who want to pay up.
Reviews.Author: richard9999

Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the money I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, the location is very good: close to the metro, starbucks and the Gran Via.The room was nice, but it has some issues that remind me more a 2 or 2 1/2 star hotel than a 4 oneThe issues were the following:A) The bathroom was like unfinished, the toilet and bidet were just place there, you can actually lift them and move them if you one, apparently they forgot to glue it.B) They did not change the sheets, I have to specially order it.C) The staff was really not up to a 4 starts hotel, we have waited around 30 minutes in the bar of the hotel before anybody came to offer something, we asked some directions and they sent us to the very opposite side of the city (we lost a meeting and two hours), I speak spanish so there is not language problem in the directions.D) Soap, they left us just one small soap for our entire stay and when I came downstairs to ask for more they said that they would not have more until the following day (we purchased some at the near Dia supermarket)But, at the end the price that we paid was very good (128 euros) , so I believe that it was ok, but for me is more a nice 3 stars hotel than a 4 one.
Reviews.Author: ale1974

Reviews.Content: Outstanding and spotless Booked the hotel after much online searching but by using trip advisor reviews and seeing how reasonably priced the rates were,this hotel ticked all the boxes.When we arrived we were overwhelmed by the very high standards throughout.It has been very tastefully and recently refurbished .Air conditioned but with balconies,flat screen tv,mini bar,safe,classy bathrooms -and all this in a superb central location in a bustling but not too busy street and near great tapas bars-Stop madrid for one.Will be back here - area safe enough for children even at night.
Reviews.Author: p8kom

Reviews.Content: 4 star hotel for budget price! My best friend and I stayed in a twin room at Hotel Lusso Infantas last week. We were so impressed. We stayed for 鈧?0 per night (before 7% VAT), which for a genuine 4 star hotel is a bargain price. Aesthetically the hotel communal areas, rooms and bathrooms are lovely; everything was clean, well maintained and there were touches of luxury too. Service was also good with great maps provided.Location is perfect. It's away from the construction sites and noise of Puerta del Sol, but only a 10 minute walk away to the west. Also, it's just off Gran Via, which has some great shopping. To the east, the Retiro park is only about a 15 minute walk away. On weekends it can be a little noisy from the revellers partying away, though I've heard that about most Madrid hotels. FYI, Hotel Lusso Infantas is only a 5 minute walk from a brilliant restaurant, Finca de Susana, which feels like a fine dining experience but also at bargain prices! My friend and I ate and drank there for 鈧?0 per head for a three course meal. Ladies, for dessert, Zamboanga's Dessert is unmissable! : ) Get there when it opens at 2030 so you don't have to queue like the rest of the tourists and locals.Back to the hotel, my friend and I really would recommend this hotel to anyone, regardless of budget; it's fantastic!
Reviews.Author: MaxiBon

Reviews.Content: Great for the price Close to the action without the action being on top of you. Great little clean hotel.I would pass on the breakfast ... no eggs. Many good places to eat close by.
Reviews.Author: ZorroAca

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel Really nice hotel, stayed at this hotel during Euro pride (July) for 3 nights. ohh what a weekend. Can't fault the hotel. The only thingI would say is the staff didn't know much about the weekend for the pride, No maps, information etc. I think the staff needs to know and be trained on more about the events that are happening around the hotel.
Reviews.Author: xxxdarren

Reviews.Content: Location Location       main room
Reviews.Author: grant_lina

Reviews.Content: Liked it! This hotel is definitely worth booking if you can get their rate of 85 Euro per night. We did pay 140 Euro per night for a couple of nights of our stay and it was still worth it (as the rest of Madrid was even more expensive!) but it would be a bargain for 85 Euros!Location was great if you want to be near the Prado/Thyssen museums, Retiro Park and the designer shops in Salamanca. The neighbourhood is cool too with lots of bars, restaurants and cafe's within a 10 minute walk.We walked to Puerto de Sol in about 10-15 minutes at a leisurely pace. We had a huge bathroom - very nicely done up with a great shower and lots of hot water! The room was a very good size too with ample cupboard space. The flat screen TV is a bit small and only has a couple of English speaking channels (both news channels!) but we weren't in the room too much in any case.The only downside is the wooden flooring and noisy doors! Wooden flooring means noise from people walking down the corridor and talking isn't cushioned - its actually amplified! And the room doors bang shut. This did disturb our sleep in the morning. We had room 201 which was next to the service lift...and really noisy service door! Also, they seem to have only 1 iron in the whole of the hotel so its probably worth taking a travel iron along if you don't want to wait for it!Breakfast was not included in our rate - but we managed on a coffee and croissant from the Starbucks which is opposite the hotel. There is a bakery just down the road from the hotel if you'd rather 'go native'!Beware - everything around the area is shut on a Sunday - except for some bars and cafes. We didn't need much service but the guys on reception were helpful and friendly.
Reviews.Author: BeenaP

Reviews.Content: Ideal place       Infantas Street /Lusso Infantas
Reviews.Author: QF1129

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel and location Spent 3 nights on mini break with my wife to see city.We are in our late fourtiesHotel was quiet (a little internal noise from residents shoes on the wooden floored corridors) , clean and pleasant with decent staff, nice bathrooms.Location very good - although the neighbourhood to the North and West was somewhat gay.We found the locals cafes to be very good value with , on the whole, pleasant staff.The trendier cafes/Restaurants/bars in the immediate neighbourhood were a little too busy and ,well, trendy for our taste. We headed South for dinners where there were more staid restaurants.
Reviews.Author: Rudge

Reviews.Content: Beyond Expectations Lusso Infantas is in a great area. It is right at Gran Via and close to the Chueca district. It is about a 10 minute walk to Puerta De Sol, the center of Spain. Wonderful, independently owned boutiques are scattered through side streets along the hotel. Not only is it a fab location, but the bathroom is large and beautiful. . . perfect for a hot bath after a day of walking all over the city. Amenities in the room are beyond expectations. Attention is paid to details. The restaurant in the hotel is amazing. One of my best meals in Madrid was served there. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Madrid.
Reviews.Author: VLWilliams12

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, OK Service Stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Rooms were very nice, large bathroom and comfortable bed. Location was great, basically in Chueca district. Reasonably close to metro stops and a Starbucks right across the street for those who can't live without it. (Tip: If you want regular coffee, ask for cafe de la semana). Service was ok. The front desk staff were kind and helpful when asked questions, but some didn't seem too interested in helping. Some of the men at the front desk were extremely helpful and nice. Service in the cafe on site wasn't great. We had to wait for the check a few times since most of the time people weren't in the cafe as they were doing other things. The restaurant was pretty good, tasty food (especially the vegetable appetizer - Must try).Walking distance to the Gran Via (beautifully decorated for Christmas), Prado Museum, Thyssen Museum, Banco de Espana metro, Chueca district.Overall, content with the hotel, just wish the service in the cafe was better.
Reviews.Author: cliffwy

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and Location       Our bathroom was huge!
Reviews.Author: Reenyroo

Reviews.Content: wonderful gem of a hotel My partner and I spent a week at the Lusso Infantas at the end of May 2006. The hotel is a magnificent ...if well hidden...gem just steps away from restaurants, shopping and charms of the Plaze del Sol, Plaza de Cibeles and Chueca districts. The service was generally unasuming but friendly and responsive. In a renovated building, the rooms are modern and nicely appointed. It was so lovely and tranquil that it was hard to drag ourselves away in the morning. In a quiet street, just off the Gran Villa it is close to all the old-world cites...and steps away from a very modern Starbucks. This is an ideal hotel for those travelers who want the charm of a boutique hotel, but are fussy about modern amenities like flat-screen TVs, clean, up-to-date bathroom sinks and tubs. There is a great breakast served in the morning and the lobby doubles as a galery for local artists. We will definitely stay again when we return next year.
Reviews.Author: JRVelasco
